abstract_summ: The highest contribution in COVID-19 research takes the form of journal articles.The study found the considerable and constant growth of Indian publications on COVID-19 from mid-April.RESULTS: The study found that there is a considerable and constant growth of Indian publications on COVID-19 from mid-April.The categorical summary of these keywords and topics may be a useful reference to expedite and recommend new and alternative directions for COVID-19 research.The present study analyzed 89 Indian publications on SARS-CoV-2 accessible through WHO COVID-19 database.
title_summ: [An analysis of global research on SARS-CoV-2].Indian Publications on SARS-CoV-2: A Bibliometric Study of WHO COVID-19 DatabaseDiscovering associations in COVID-19 related research papersInformation Mining for COVID-19 Research From a Large Volume of Scientific LiteratureIndian Publications on SARS-CoV-2: A bibliometric study of WHO COVID-19 database
title_abstract_phrases: Indian Publications on SARS-CoV-2: A bibliometric study of WHO COVID-19 databaseBACKGROUND & AIMS: Nowadays, the whole World is under threat of Coronavirus disease (COVID-19).The study found the considerable and constant growth of Indian publications on COVID-19 from mid-April.RESULTS: The study found that there is a considerable and constant growth of Indian publications on COVID-19 from mid-April.The present study analyzed 89 Indian publications on SARS-CoV-2 accessible through WHO COVID-19 database.The present study analyzed Indian publications on SARS-CoV-2 as found in WHO COVID-19 database.
